title: Imam Zayn al-Abidin (as)
text: INFO: Introduction

DESC: By looking at the circumstances and the impact of Lady Zaynabâ€™s sermon on the audience, Yazid asked one of his orators to get on the pulpit in order to tarnish the image of Imam Ali (as) in general and that of Imam Husayn (as) in particular. This was Yazidâ€™s way of damage control for the impact of Bibi Zaynabâ€™s (as) sermon.
DESC: As someone in the pay of the imperial court, the orator went on the pulpit and fulfilled his masterâ€™s wishes by talking ill about Imam â€˜Ali and highly praising Muâ€˜awiyah and Yazid.
DESC: When Imam Zayn Al-Abidin heard it, he shouted at him:
â€œO the speaker! You have bought the pleasure of a created being by displeasing the Creator, and so have reserved a seat for yourself in the Hell-fire.â€
DESC: Then the Imam turned to Yazid and said,
â€œO Yazid, allow me to get on this â€˜piece of woodâ€™ and say something that would please Allah and be a cause of His blessings for the audience.â€
DESC: Yazid refused.

DESC: (Comment: It is interesting to see the Imam describing the pulpit as â€œpiece of woodâ€ and not a â€œmimbar â€“ pulpitâ€ â€“ a seat used for uttering words that would displease Allah is not worthy of being called â€œmimbar.â€)

DESC: The people started insisting, â€œO the leader, let him go on the pulpit so that we can hear what he has to say.â€ Yazid replied, â€œIf he goes on the pulpit, he will not get down until he has humiliated me and the family of Abu Sufyan.â€
DESC: The people said, â€œWhat can this person say?â€ They were looking at his young age and his status as a prisoner.
DESC: Yazid responded, â€œHe is member of a family who is steeped in knowledge.â€ The peopleâ€™s insistence increased until he had to give in.
DESC: Imam Zayn Al-Abidin (as) got on the pulpit and gave a sermon in which he focused on the family of Imam Ali (as) and the Prophet (saww).
INFO: Sermon
DESC: ğŸ’  The Preamble

All praise is due to Allah who has no beginning, and the Eternal who has no end, the one who is the First but not in the sense of numbers and the Last but in the sense of ending, and the one who will last after everything perishes. He created nights and days, and distributed sustenance among the people. So blessed is Allah, the King, the All-Knowing.
DESC: ğŸ’  The Status of Prophetâ€™s Family
O people! We [the family of the Prophet] have been blessed with six [qualities] and have been preferred [over others] by seven [individuals]:
We have been blessed with knowledge, forbearance, generosity, eloquence, courage and love in hearts of the believers.

We have been preferred [over others] through the Chosen Prophet, Muhammad who is from us, the truthful one [i.e Ali] who is from us, the one who flies [in heaven, Jaâ€™far] is from us, the lion of God and the Prophet [Hamzah] is from us, the chief of the women of the worlds, the pure Fatimah, is from us, and the Prophetâ€™s two grandsons in this community [Hasan & Husayn] are from us.
DESC: ğŸ’  â€œWho am I?â€
Whoever knows me knows me; but one who does not know me, I shall inform him of my status and noble descent.
I am the son of Mecca and Mina, I am the son of Zamzam and Safa.1

I am son of he who raised the Black Stone in his robe, I am the son of the best one who put on the shirt and robe, I am the son of the best one who put on the shoes and walked, I am the son of the best one who did the circumambulation (tawaf) and saâ€˜i, I am the son of the best one who did the pilgrimage and responded to Allahâ€™s call, I am the son of the one who was carried on the Buraq on the air, I am the son of one who was taken in the night journey from Masjidul Haram to Masjid al-Aqsa,2 I am the son of the one who reached with Jibraâ€™il [in his ascension] to the sidratul muntaha (the holiest spot in heaven),3 I am the son of the one who reached very close to that holy spot, I am the son of the one who prayed with the angels two cycles, I am the son of the one to whom God sent revelation. [In short,] I am the son of Muhammad al-Muá¹£tafa.

I am the son of â€˜Ali al-Murtaza, I am son of the one who subdued the people till they said: la ilaha illal lah, I am the son of the one who fought in defense of the Prophet with two swords and two spears, did two migrations4 pledged allegiance to the Prophet twice,5 prayed towards two qiblahs, courageously fought in Badr and Hunayn, and never ever disbelieved in Allah!

I am the son of â€˜the righteous one among the believers,â€™6 the successor of the prophets, destroyer of the disbelievers, leader of the Muslims, light of the mujahidin, prince of the worshippers, â€˜crownâ€™ of those who cry [in their prayers], the most patient of those who exercise patience, the best among those who stand for prayer from the family of Taha and Yasin, the Messenger of the Lord of the universe.

I am the son of the one who was supported by Jibraâ€™il and Mikaâ€™il, I am the son of the one who protected the sanctities of the Muslims, who fought the rebels, the deviants, and the violators, and who confronted his hateful enemies.

I am the son of the one who is most honourable among the Quraysh, and the first among believers to respond to Allah and His Messenger, the first among the foremost ones, the one who crushed the back of the rebels and destroyed the idol-worshippers; the one who was an arrow from the arrows of Allah against the hypocrites; the tongue of the wisdom of the worshippers, the helper of Allahâ€™s religion, the friend of Allah, the garden of Allahâ€™s wisdom, the vessel of Allahâ€™s knowledgeâ€¦ the father of the two grandsons of the Prophet, al-Hasan and al-Husayn, demonstrator of the extra-ordinary feats, destroyers of the divisions, the shooting star, the lasting light, the victorious lion of Allah â€“ that is my grandfather, â€˜Ali bin Abi Talib.

I am the son of Fatimatu â€™z-Zahraâ€™, I am the son of the chief of the women, I am the son of the pure Batul, I am the son of â€˜the part of the Messenger;â€™ and I am the son of Khadijatu â€™l-Kubra.

I am the son of the person killed unjustly, the son of one whose head was severed from the back of the neck, I am the son of the one who was thirsty till the last moment, I am the son of one who was abandoned in Karbala, I am the son of the one whose blood soaked in the dust â€“ I am the son of the one who was slaughtered in Karbala.

I am the son of the one on whom the angels of the heavens cried, I am the son of the one on whom the jinn in the earth and birds in the sky wailed. I am the son of the one whose head was paraded on the spear; I am the son of the one whose family was made prisoners from Iraq to Sham.

DESC: According to the narrations, Imam Zayn Al-Abidin continued to say â€œI amâ€¦â€ and â€œI amâ€¦â€ until the people started to cry and Yazid feared their reaction. Then Yazid asked the muâ€™adhdhin to sound the call for prayer so that the Imam would be forced to stop his speech.

DESC: The muâ€™adhdhin started the call for prayer. He said, â€œAllahu akbar â€“ Allah is the greatest,â€ and the Imam affirmed the greatness of Allah. Then the muâ€™adhdhin said, â€œAsh-hadu an la ilaha il-lal-lah â€“ I bear witness that there is no god but Allah,â€ and the Imam affirmed the unity of God.

DESC: When the muâ€™adhdhin uttered the third phrase of the adhan, â€œash-hadu anna Muhammadan Rasulu â€™l-lah â€“ I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah,â€ the Imam turned towards Yazid and said:

O Yazid! This Muhammad is my grandfather or your grandfather? If you say that he is your grandfather, then you are a liar and you will become kafir; and if you say that he is my grandfather, then why did you kill his family? Why did you kill my father and made his women captives?
DESC: Yazid ordered the muâ€™adhdhin to start the iqamah to start the prayer. Imam Zayn Al-Abidinâ€™s speech had such an impact that many people stood up and left without praying behind Yazid.
